name: FieldValue
title: Google

Firestore
FieldValue
description:
FieldValue

Represents a change to be made to fields in document data in the Firestore API.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/firestore"

firestore = Google::Cloud::Firestore.new

user_snap = firestore.doc("users/frank").get

methods.name: type
title: Google
Cloud
Firestore
FieldValue#type
methods.description: The type of change to make to an individual field in document data.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/firestore"

firestore = Google::Cloud::Firestore.new

# Get a document reference
nyc_ref = firestore.doc "cities/NYC"

field_delete = Google::Cloud::Firestore::FieldValue.delete
field_delete.type #=> :delete

nyc_ref.update({ name: "New York City",
                 trash: field_delete })

methods.name: server_time
title: Google

Firestore
FieldValue.server_time
methods.description: Creates a field value object representing set a fieldâ€™s value to the server timestamp when accessing the document data.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/firestore"

firestore = Google::Cloud::Firestore.new

methods.name: array_union
title: Google
Cloud
Firestore
FieldValue.array_union
methods.description: Creates a sentinel value to indicate the union of the given values with an array.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/firestore"

firestore = Google::Cloud::Firestore.new

# Get a document reference
nyc_ref = firestore.doc "cities/NYC"

array_union = Google::Cloud::Firestore::FieldValue.array_union(
  1, 2, 3
)

nyc_ref.update({ name: "New York City",
                 lucky_numbers: array_union })

params.name: values
params.description: The values to add to the array. Required.

returns.description: The array union field value object.

methods.name: array_delete
title: Google
Cloud
Firestore
FieldValue.array_delete
methods.description: Creates a sentinel value to indicate the removal of the given values with an array.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/firestore"

firestore = Google::Cloud::Firestore.new

# Get a document reference
nyc_ref = firestore.doc "cities/NYC"

array_delete = Google::Cloud::Firestore::FieldValue.array_delete(
  7, 8, 9
)

nyc_ref.update({ name: "New York City",
                 lucky_numbers: array_delete })

params.name: values
params.description: The values to remove from the array. Required.

returns.description: The array delete field value object.
